result.execSummary:
The defendant David Edward Inkmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay costs and DNA surcharge within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.
Court will not grant expungement on this case.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Edward Inkmann

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David Edward Inkmann in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CF-132, 15TR-853 and 15CM-165.

9:16 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Atty Cousins states that 15TR-853 has not been discussed, do not have a resolution on this case.
Atty Drengler was aware of this charge but did not contemplate about a resolution, requests criminal cases to proceed and TR case will be discussed after Court. 

Parties take a moment to discuss.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court. There is an agreement.
15CF-132 Defendant is pleading to Count 1. Counts 2 and 3 dismissed and read in. 
15CM-165: Defendant is pleading to Count 1. Count 2 dismissed and read in.
15TR-853: stipulation will be filed
Defense is free to argue.

Atty Drengler concurs.

Defendant concurs.

Address of Defendant is verified.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.


Defendant enters a plea of: 
NO CONTEST Count 1 15CF-132
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1 15CM-165

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Drengler for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

Court takes a moment to re-review the criminal complaints.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF-132: Count 1: Possession with Intent to Deliver THC
15CF-132: Count 2: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-132: Count 3: Dismissed and Read In
15CM-165: Count 1: Possession of THC
15CM-165: Count 2: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court, there is a joint recommendation in 15CF-132. 15CM-165 is an argued sentencing.
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Court finds plea agreement in 15CF-132 fair and appropriate.

BY THE COURT:
15CF-132
Count 1:
Jail sentence for a period of 180 Days, Imposed and Stayed
Huber granted for work, school, counseling and any other reason the Sheriff will allow
May serve second half on home monitoring program if Defendant qualifies after Sheriff's Department does their assessment
Probation for a period of 24 Months
Conditions:
Pay a fine of $200 plus costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Perform 50 Hours of Community Service preferrably with Portage County Parks Department
AODA and comply with treatment recommendations
Maintain absolute sobriety with regard to illegal drugs and controlled substances
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription
Maintain full time employment or schooling or a combination of both to equal full time
Participate in any other counseling as recommended by the agent and comply with treatment recommendations
Upon successful completion of probation and shows proper attitude and with the agent's recommendation, Court will grant expungement on this case

15CM-165
Count 1:
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
60 days to pay or set up payment plan
Court will not grant expungement on this case
  

15TR-853: Court will set this matter for a pretrial  on September 08, 2015, at 8:30 AM

Defendant David Inkmann in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case 15CF132, 15TR853, 15CM165 heard today.
15CF132:   Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Time limits waived for 15CF132.
States request cash bond:
BTC:  15CF132: $5,000 sig bond:   Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
15TR853 P/ng entered and to follow 15CF132.
15CM165:    Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties. P/NG entered.
Bond continued. Following 15CF132.  Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
